statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Massachusetts 78, Yale 69
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. (AP) -- James Life scored a team-high 16 points, including four 3-pointers, to lead Massachusetts to a 78-69 win over Yale on Thursday night. Rashaun Freeman added 12 points and Brandon Thomas 11 for the Minutemen. UMass' Stephane Lasme had a strong defensive game with 16 rebounds, 15 of which were defensive. He also had seven blocks. Yale's Eric Flato had a game-high 22 points, and Casey Hughes had 12. Yale (2-8) recovered from a horrendous start by pulling even at 30 on a 3-point basket by Nick Holmes with 2:20 left in the first half. But UMass (10-3) went on a 10-2 run at the end of the half, with Tiki Mayben getting half of his team's points and beating the buzzer with a 3-pointer to give the Minutemen a 40-32 halftime lead. UMass had jumped to a 10-0 advantage as it took Yale more than five minutes to get its first points. Matt Kyle's score on a goaltending call at 14:56 broke the Bulldogs drought. Life, with three 3-pointers and nine points, led the Minutemen in the first half. Flato had nine points for the Elis. In the second half, the Bulldogs came within 44-43 on two free throws by Hughes. But Life's 3-pointer started the Minutemen's pullaway. UMass led by as much as 74-59 in the second half.
